moves.6... h6 7. Bxf6 exf6: exf must be wrong: d pawn is completely isolated. gxf is much better.
moves.8. Bc4: white is much more advanced and well centered. no merit: all the credit to black's bad moves.
moves.8... Be7 9. O-O O-O 10. f4: already planning the attack: white has to take profit of this advance.
moves.10... Nc6 11. f5: blocking almost everything here, for black side.
moves.12. Nd5: well, try me... If Qxd4+ then 13. Qxd4 Nxd4 14 Nxe7+, white is still better.
moves.14. Bb3: I still need my white clear bishop.
moves.17. Bxd5 Ra7 18. Qe2: allowing Ra1 to join the battlefield
the attack is for later now.
moves.32... Rc5 33. Nb3: here, Rxa2 would be wrong because of Nxc5, of course.
moves.33... Rc7 34. Re3: this is a mistake... fortunately without huge consequences
moves.34... Rxa2 35. Ra1: simplifying to give credit to my bishop
moves.35... Rxa1+ 36. Nxa1: only problem: my knight is far from the center.
moves.36... g6: good move: trying to liberate the king.
moves.39. Ke2 Kh6 40. h4: blocking the king, but allowing Ng4.
moves.40... Rc5 41. Bb3: keeping an eye on f7 and c4.
moves.41... a5: trying to capitalize its only good pawn.
moves.42. Nc2: it gave me the time to finally come back.
moves.43. Rg3: only move to avoid repetition or loss.
moves.44... Nxe3 45. Rxe3 Rxf5 46. Bxf7: And now, nothing can stop me any more... As black, I wouldn't have dared to continue...
moves.47. c4 Re5: last trap! but I didn't panic
moves.48. Rxe5 fxe5: looks like a4 has a freeway?
moves.49. Ke3: well, let's give him a hope, then...
moves.50... dxc5: 2 pawns for a piece... would it be sufficient?
moves.55... Kh7 56. Kg5 Kg7 57. Ba2: tempo to avoid Kxh5 Kf6 which could prolong the game.
moves.57... Kh7 58. Kxh5 Kg7 59. g4: Now i don't care anymore about Kf6
moves.60. Kg5 Kg7 61. h5 Kh7 62. Kf6 Kh8 63. g: I don't get it, because with as much time as I have to think and avoid a draw, it sounds... offensive to continue.
moves.63... Kh7 64. g6+ Kh8 65. g7+ Kh7 66. g8: finally resigns... Not a word, not a hi, nothing. I won't play him again, unless forced in a tournament.
